requirements.summary: Create homepage with Netflix-inspired hero section featuring a prominent movie recap
acceptanceCriteria: Hero section displays a featured movie recap with large background image
Title and description overlay on hero image
Primary CTA button (e.g., 'Read Recap') is prominently displayed
Visual styling matches Netflix's dark theme and layout proportions

file_operations.description: Create hero section component with featured movie backdrop using generated image at frontend/public/assets/generated/hero-bg.dim_1920x1080.png, title/description overlay, and 'Read Recap' CTA button. Component fetches a featured movie from backend and displays it prominently with Netflix-style dark overlay gradient.

requirements.summary: Implement horizontal scrollable rows of movie cards organized by categories
acceptanceCriteria: Multiple category rows displayed vertically on homepage
Each row contains horizontally scrollable movie cards
Cards show movie poster thumbnail and title
Smooth horizontal scroll interaction
Hover effects on cards (scale up, show additional info)

file_operations.description: Create category row component that displays a horizontal scrollable list of movie cards with category title. Implements smooth scroll behavior and uses generated poster images (poster-action-1.dim_300x450.png, poster-drama-1.dim_300x450.png, poster-comedy-1.dim_300x450.png, poster-thriller-1.dim_300x450.png) for sample movies. Fetches movies by category from backend using searchMovies method.

Create movie card component with poster thumbnail, title overlay, and hover scale-up effect. On click, navigates to detail page. Displays add-to-list button on hover. Uses posterUrl from Movie interface to display images.

requirements.summary: Create top navigation bar with logo, browse menu, search icon, and user profile section
acceptanceCriteria: Fixed navigation bar at top of page
Logo/brand name on the left
Navigation links (Home, Categories, My List) in center
Search and profile icons on the right
Background transitions from transparent to solid on scroll
Navigation remains visible and accessible at all times

file_operations.description: Create fixed navigation bar component with logo image at frontend/public/assets/generated/logo.dim_200x80.png on left, navigation links (Home, Categories, My List) in center, and search/profile icons on right. Implements scroll listener to transition background from transparent to solid black. Includes mobile hamburger menu collapse.

requirements.summary: Build movie detail page that displays full recap script with movie metadata
acceptanceCriteria: Detail page shows movie title, year, genre, and estimated reading time
Full recap script displayed in readable typography
Background features movie poster or backdrop image
Back navigation to return to browse view
Recap text is formatted with proper paragraphs and spacing

file_operations.description: Create movie detail page that fetches movie data using getMovie backend method based on route parameter. Displays backdrop image (e.g., backdrop-1.dim_1280x720.png for sample movie), movie metadata (title, year, genre, duration), and full recap script with readable typography. Includes back button to return to browse view and add-to-list button.

requirements.summary: Implement search functionality that filters movies by title in grid layout
acceptanceCriteria: Search input in navigation bar
Real-time filtering as user types
Results displayed in grid layout
Each result shows movie poster and title
Clicking result navigates to detail page
Empty state when no results found

file_operations.description: Create search modal component that opens from navigation bar search icon. Implements real-time search using searchMovies backend method as user types. Displays results in grid layout with movie posters and titles. Includes empty state message when no results found.
Add search icon button that opens SearchModal component. Wire modal state management and toggle functionality.

requirements.summary: Add 'My List' feature allowing users to save movie recaps with persistent storage
acceptanceCriteria: Add/remove button on movie cards and detail pages
My List page displays all saved movies
List persists across sessions
Visual indicator shows when movie is in list
List accessible from navigation menu

file_operations.description: Create My List page that fetches user's saved movies using getList backend method. Displays movies in grid layout similar to search results. Each card includes remove button that calls removeFromList backend method.

Create custom hook for managing My List state. Provides methods to check if movie is in list, add movie (calls addToList backend method), remove movie (calls removeFromList backend method), and fetch list (calls getList backend method). Manages loading and error states.
Add add-to-list button that appears on hover. Use useMyList hook to check if movie is in list, show visual indicator, and handle add/remove actions.
Add add-to-list button to detail page using useMyList hook. Show visual indicator when movie is already in list.

requirements.summary: Implement responsive design adapting Netflix-style layout for all screen sizes
acceptanceCriteria: Movie card rows adapt number of visible items based on screen width
Navigation collapses to hamburger menu on mobile
Hero section scales appropriately on all devices
Touch-friendly interactions on mobile devices
Maintains Netflix-style aesthetics across all breakpoints

file_operations.description: Add responsive grid/flex layout using Tailwind breakpoints to show different numbers of cards per row (2 on mobile, 3 on tablet, 4-6 on desktop). Ensure horizontal scroll works smoothly on touch devices.
Implement hamburger menu for mobile screens using Tailwind responsive utilities. Add mobile menu drawer that slides in from side with navigation links.
Add responsive layout adjustments using Tailwind breakpoints. Scale hero text size, button size, and image height appropriately for mobile, tablet, and desktop screens.

requirements.summary: Apply cohesive dark theme visual design inspired by Netflix aesthetic
acceptanceCriteria: Dark background (near-black) as primary color
Red accent color for primary actions and branding
Clean, modern sans-serif typography
Consistent spacing and padding throughout
Subtle shadows and depth effects on cards
Smooth transitions and animations

file_operations.description: Define Netflix-inspired dark theme color palette in CSS custom properties: near-black background (#141414), dark gray surfaces (#181818), red accent (#e50914). Set base typography to sans-serif font family. Apply dark background to body element.

Extend Tailwind theme with Netflix color palette (netflix-black, netflix-red, netflix-gray variations). Configure custom spacing scale for consistent padding/margins. Add custom shadow utilities for card depth effects.
Apply subtle shadow, smooth hover scale transition, and consistent border radius. Use Netflix theme colors from Tailwind config.

requirements.summary: Wire hero section and movie rows into main application

file_operations.description: Create homepage that composes Navbar, HeroSection, and multiple MovieRow components for different categories (Trending Recaps, Action Movies, Drama, Comedy, Thriller). Fetches initial data and passes to child components.
Set up React Router with routes for HomePage (/), MovieDetailPage (/movie/:title), and MyListPage (/my-list). Wrap application with router and ensure dark theme is applied globally.
